150499-d-11-16-17-ATK.Contributing Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
150499-d-11-16-17-ATK.Narrative: YARD CREW YL220 HANDLING APPROXIMATELY 9 CARS MADE A SHOVING MOVEMENT INTO TRACK #95, DROPPED 5 CARSOF THEIR CUT AND COUPLED TO 6 CARS ALREADY POSITIONED ON THAT TRACK.  CREW PROCEEDED NORTH WITH THEIR LOCOMOTIVE E/510 AND 4 EMPTY COACH CARS 33048, 34951, 6402, 33026.  AFTER MOVING APPROXIMATELY 3-4 CAR LENGTHS THE MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED JUST NORTH OF THE SWITCH CONTROLLING MOVEMENT BETWEEN 95 & 94.  THE ASSISTANT CONDUCTOR DE-TRAINED FROM THE EAST SIDE OF C/33026 AND WALKED SOUTH CROSSING OVER IN FRONT OF C/33026 WALKING TOWARDS THE SWITCH CONTROLLING MOVEMENT BETWEEN 94 & 93 TRACKS AND DID NOT HANDLE THE SWITCH CONTROLLING MOVEMENT BETWEEN 95 & 94 TRACKS LEAVING IT ALIGNED FOR MOVEMENT INTOTRACK 95.  LOCOMOTIVE E/510 AND ATTACHED CARS INITIATED MOVEMENT SOUTH UNDER THE DIRECTION OF THE CONDUCTOR AT THE HOOK AT THE BOTTOM OF TRACK 93 AND ACCELERATED TO APPROXIMATELY 10 MPH, STRIKING THECUT OF 11 CARS ON TRACK 95.  FOUR CARS, C/33026-C/6402-C/33048-C/34951, DERAILED AND BOTH EAST & WEST RAIL LEADING INTO 95 TRACK IS ROLLED OVER FOR APPROXIMATELY 1 1/2 CAR LENGTHS.  AMTRAKS EQUIPMENTDAMAGE IS $89,757.00 AND  THE MOW DAMAGE IS $4,757.00.

THE TRAIN WAS COMPOSED OF 4 LOCOMOTIVE ENGINES AND 5 EMPTY TANK CARS.  AS THE TRAIN WAS LEAVING THE YARD AREA WITH EMPTY TANK CARS, THE FIRST TANKER CAR IN THE TRAINDERAILED.  EVENTUALLY ALL 5 DERAILED NEAR THE (BONNEVILLE GATE);  LOCOMOTIVES #2008 AND #3000 EVENTUALLY ALSO DERAILED.  THERE WAS A RUPTURE TO THE LOCOMOTIVE #2008 DIESEL FUEL TANK.  IT WAS ESTIMATEDTHAT 100 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL SPILLED.  ENVIRO TECH. WAS CONTACTED BY UTAH RAIL TO PUMP OUT THE REMAINING FUEL AND TO ALSO MAKE THE NEARBY SOIL CLEANUP.  THE LOCOMOTIVE AND TANK CARS WERE RE-RAILEDAND THE DAMAGED TRACK AND DISRUPTED BALLAST WAS REPLACED/REPAIRED BY THE UTA MAINTENANCE OF WAY DEPARTMENT WHICH CONTRACTED WITH STACY & WITBECK, INC.

112717-d-11-27-17-NYA.Narrative: YARD CREW WAS SWITCHING AN INBOUNDED TRAIN IN FREMONT YARD.  THE CREW HAD MU'D SIX LOCOMOTIVES TOGETHER TO PERFORM THEIR SWITCHING MOVES.  THE CAR DIRECTLY BEHIND THE LOCOMOTIVES WAS AN EMPTY BULKHEADFLATCAR.  THE ENGINEER BEGAN SHOVING WEST AHOLD OF 44 CARS WITHOUT WAITING A SUFFICIENT TIME FOR THE AIR BRAKES TO FULLY RELEASE.  AS THE EMPTY FLAT CAR ROUNDED A CURVE, IT CAME OFF THE RAILS.  THE ENGINEER DID NOT IMMEDIATELY REALIZE THAT A CAR WAS DERAILED AND CONTINUED TO SHOVE UNTIL ALL SIX LOCOMOTIVES WERE ALSO DERAILED, CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH TRACK AND EQUIPMENT.  EQUIPMENT DAMAGES AMENDED091818 FOLLOWING AUDIT.

DGN482917S-d-11-08-17-DGNO.Narrative: ON WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 8, 2017 AT 1015AM  A TRANSPORTATION EMPLOYEE ON THE DGNO RAILROAD CUT OFF CARS IN THE FOUL THEN SIDE SWIPED HIS OWN TRAIN WITH THE LOCOMOTIVES.  THE CREW CUT THE ENGINES AWAY FROM THE CARS BUT DID NOT VERIFY THE CUT OF CARS LEFT BEHIND WERE IN THE CLEAR.  THE ENGINE WAS MOVEDEAST DOWN THE TRACK FOR A WAYS TO ALLOW A MECHANIC TO DIAGNOSE A VIBRATION ON THE ENGINE.  THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE SWITCH FOR THE TRACK ADJACENT TO THE FOULING CARS THEY CUT AWAY FROM.  THE ENGINE WASTHEN MOVED WEST IN ORDER TO RUN AROUND THE CARS FROM WHICH THEY HAD CUT AWAY.   THE ENGINE COLLIDEDWITH THE LEAD CAR OF THE CUT LEFT IN THE FOUL DAMAGING BOTH LOCOMOTIVES AND THE TANK CAR.

SWITCHMAN WAS AT THE #3 SWITCH AND BEGAN PROTECTING THE SHOVE FROM THERE, UTILIZING THE TRIANGLE OF VISION TO SEND THE CUT TO THE FOREMAN, WHO WAS INSIDE OF TRACK 002, NEAR NEW BRAUNFELS ST. BRIDGE.  ONCE THE FOREMAN TOOK CONTROL OFTHE SHOVE, HE ASKED THE SWITCHMAN FOR THE CUT NUMBER.  SWITCHMAN LOOKED UP TO SEE WHERE THEY WERE ONTHE SWITCHLIST AND NOTICED TWO SETS OF WELL CARS COMING TOWARDS HIM, INTO DIFFERENT TRACKS.  ONE WAS GOING TOWARDS TRACK 002 AND THE OTHER WAS GOING DOWN THE WHEEL YARD LEAD.  MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED ONCE THIS WAS NOTICED.  DAMAGE DONE TO MULTIPLE SWITCHES, RAIL, CARS, TRACK, POWER LINES AND WEST ENDSWITCH SHANTY.  NO INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED.

IN17112800-d-11-28-17-TIBR.Narrative: THE CREW WAS TAKING EMPTY COAL TRAIN BACK TO INTERCHANGE AND WAS ON THIER WAY HOME WHEN THE TRAINMASTER RECEIVED A CALL FROM THE PLANT STATING THEY HAD FOUND A SET OF WHEELS BESIDE A SWITCH BACK AT THE PLANT. THE TRAIMASTER CONTACTED THE BNSF AND TOLD THEM NOT TO MOVE THE TRAIN UNTILL IT WAS INSPECTED BEFORE BEING MOVED. TIBR TRAINMASTER ALONG WITH THE TIBR GM, TIBR ROADMATER, AND THE BNSF TRAINMASTER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LAST CAR IN TRAIN MISSING THE REAR SET OF WHEELS. THE LAST CAR HAD DERIALED BACK AT THE SWITCH BACK IN PLANT WHEN IT CLIMBED THE FROG AT THE SWITCH. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE GUARD RAILON AT THE FROG WAS LOOSE THUS ALLOWING THE WHEELS TO CROSSOVER THE FROG AND DERAIL.THIS SWITCH WHERE POINT OF DERIALMENT IS INSPECTED AND MAINTAINED BY ENTERGY.

941599-d-11-12-17-IC.Narrative: CREW WAS YARDING INTERMODAL TRAIN, Q11851-05, FROM EM08 TO EM02. THEY THEN SHOVED A CUT INTO EM03 AND THE LAST MOVE WAS TO GO INTO EM04. THE CONDUCTOR PULLED THE CUT HIGH TO SHOVE EM02 AND INADVERTENTLY LINED THE EM10 SWITCH AGAINST HIMSELF AFTER LINING EM02 NORMAL. WHEN HE SHOVED HIS CUT OF CARS FOR EM03 HE TRAILED THROUGH THE EM10 SWITCH THAT WAS LINED AGAINST HIS MOVEMENT. AFTER SPOTTING EM03,HE PULLED APPROX. 400' NORTH TO GET OVER THE EM04 SWITCH AND WHEN THEY STARTED SHOVING HE SAW THE CONTAINERS START TO WOBBLE AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT. THE MOVEMENT CAUSED DTTX 885052 TO TRACK DOWN EM10 WHILE THE OTHER CARS WERE TRACKING DOWN EM08. WHEN THEY SHOVED BACK TOWARDS EM04 THEY DERAILED DTTX 885052 AND DTTX 459190. THE CONDUCTOR WAS TESTED FOR CAUSE, ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE. CREW DERAILED A TOTAL OF 8 TUBS ON THE INTERMODAL TRAIN.
